content:
Topic: NPU (Nomenclature for Properties and Units) and FHIR
Running topics: IPA, IPS, terminology services

Teams call: https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_MWM4YzU1NzgtZDMwZi00NDQyLTljYzUtZmIyNzFiZGFmNjQx%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%22ca4ef9a8-6017-4d6f-b345-ed904be37123%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%225f7c049e-16dc-4481-bfb3-ff79b4f28d4e%22%7d

NPU is roughly 29000 codes and can be downloaded at https://www.npu-terminology.org/npu-database/ or https://www.labterm.dk/download/Index1 and looks easily translated to FHIR codesystems and valuesets. What is of greater importance is probably to start the dialogue with the custodian organization behind NPU: https://www.npu-terminology.org/contact-us/

FYI @Øyvind Aassve / @Thomas Tveit Rosenlund / @Espen Stranger Seland if we are to suggest eg. NPU or ICPC as a maintaned code system in HL7, I think the process is to submit a request found at https://confluence.hl7.org/display/TA/Request+Content+in+External+Terminologies

(If I can convince the rest of the affiliate in DK, I'll go ahead with ICPC as I have already draftet the danish supplement at https://github.com/hl7dk/dk-core/blob/feature/icpc-supplement/input/resources/icpc2e-dk.xml )

Sounds good @Jens Villadsen - sorry I missed the last half of the call last meeting. What is the consequence of suggesting this as an HL7 maintained code system - that is what is the difference from us just defiing a unique URL and handling this ourselves? I can understand that NPU has not been registered earlier as the use is mainly Scandinavian, but I thought ICPC had broader adoption .....
@Jens Villadsen Do you want HL7 to maintain the code system content (which seems unlikely), or are you suggesting that it would be good for HL7 to host a "convenience copy" (in THO)?

Rob Hausam said:

... are you suggesting that it would be good for HL7 to host a "convenience copy" (in THO)?

-that part
I mean - why wouldn't HL7 be interested in hosting a convenience copy of it? Ain't HL7 supposed to be a standard organization that aims to make IT easier across the healthcare domain?
and ICPC even contains mapping tables to ICD-10 - (https://browser.icpc-3.info/) - it would make a lot of sense to also have that present in ConceptMaps and so on

@Jens Villadsen No need, we have full control of the use and maintainance of NPU and the Nordic versions, so we don't meed to involve HL7. Publishing it as a FHIR CodeSystem/setting up a terminology server is another matter, of course.
@Espen Stranger Seland for NPU I fully agree with you. For ICPC its probably another mattter

Some high level descriptions about publishing code systems etc.:
https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/Publishing+terminology+to+the+FHIR+Ecosystem

Espen Stranger Seland said:

Publishing it as a FHIR CodeSystem/setting up a terminology server is another matter, of course.

So let's make that the question then? If the goal is to reach higher adoption of the terminology, making it available as FHIR Terminology resources should be a natural aim. It shouldn't require a huge amount of resources either - the terminology service as such could be pretty lightweight for starters. Doable?
@Petter Wolff - certainly doable
@Daniel Karlsson wouldn't you agree?
OK - I have parsed the NPU into a codesystem now ... should I throw it at a term server or just add it to an IG for now?
Or both?
Or both ofc

Jens Villadsen said:

and ICPC even contains mapping tables to ICD-10 - (https://browser.icpc-3.info/) - it would make a lot of sense to also have that present in ConceptMaps and so on

Should anyone reverse engineer that site to conceptmaps?
There would be official mapping tables to make it simpler. We use ICPC-2 in Norway, so I don't think we have tables for ICPC-3.
